It is sad to hear of your plight. What do you mean by 'feeling Napaak most%0D%0Aof the time'?%0D%0A%0D%0AThere is no need to wash all over your body after going to the toilet. Why%0D%0Adoes it take you so long to take a shower? Quite often, Shaytaan instills%0D%0Adoubts into the hearts of people. As a result, people continue washing parts%0D%0Aof the body and they still don't feel satisfied about those parts being%0D%0Athoroughly cleansed. This is one of the reasons the Shari'ah has enforced%0D%0Athe rule of washing three times only.%0D%0A%0D%0AOnce you wash thrice, your Ghusl or Wudhu is complete. If you are still not%0D%0Asatisfied about the area being clean after washing thrice, be rest assured%0D%0Athat Shaytaan is trying to instill doubts into your mind. Just leave it at%0D%0Athat and ignore it. Once you continue ignoring these Shaytaani doubts, your%0D%0Acondition will improve after a few days. Don't succumb to the dictates of%0D%0AShaytaan.%0D%0A%0D%0AAs far as your urine problem is concerned, it seems you are a Ma'zoor%0D%0A(excused person). A different set of rules apply to the Paaki and Napaaki of%0D%0Aa Ma'zoor (refer attached).%0D%0A%0D%0AIf any part of the bedding is soiled after a wet dream, it should be washed.%0D%0AIf no part of it is soiled, don't bother.%0D%0A%0D%0AContinue with the recitation of the Qur'aan after making Wudhu.
